result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Cole Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The fine and costs are to be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning January 16, 2017.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Cole Meyer

Defendant Justin Cole Meyer in court with attorney John Michael Schellpfeffer.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim notification has been complied with.  Plea of guilty.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, volunarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.    Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Schellpfeffer. Court orders $100.00 fine plus costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  Fine and costs to be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning January 16, 2017.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 21, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Justin Cole Meyer in court with attorney John Michael Schellpfeffer.  Defendant Justin Cole Meyer in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond Continued.    Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 10:45 am.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with J.D.D.-dob: 2-5-77.  The sheriff's department shall assist the defendant in retrieving his personal property.
Initial appearance set for December 13, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

ADR began at 1:21 pm.  Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin C. Meyer appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a a $500.00 signature bond; booking; no contact with J.D.D. - dob:  2-5-77.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders bond as requested  by Attorney Tlusty.  The court also ordered that the sheriff's department shall assist the defendant in retrieving his personal property.  Next court date is December 13, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  ADR ended at 1:24 pm.  - rt
